summary: Makes you jump higher and farther while transformed into a werewolf.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=orange][size=5]THIS MOD REQUIRES "SKYRIM SCRIPT EXTENDER".[/size]
You can download it here: [url=http://skse.silverlock.org]http://skse.silverlock.org[/url]
Follow the instructions in the "Readme" file.
It's a very useful (I'd say essential) "mod" and it's easy to install.

[/color]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=132116373](Link to "Werewolves Jump Higher (and Farther)" on [color=yellow]Steam Workshop[/color])[/url]


[size=4]-Description-[/size]

This mod changes the Game Settings "fJumpHeightMin" and "fJumpMoveMult", doubling their default values when the player is transformed into a werewolf. Those two settings are respectively the height of the player's jumps and the multiplier that determines how far you go with jumps.
It also multiplies by 1.5 the value of "fJumpFallHeightMin", so that you can jump down higher places without getting damage.
When the player turns back to normal, those settings are reset to the default values.


[size=4]-Updates-[/size]

[color=lightblue]Misc. update:[/color] I made a version that works alongside [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49167/]"Athletic Jump" by EnigmaWolf[/url]. If you use/want to use that mod, you have to
use this specific version of "Werewolves Jump Higher and Farther". Notice that it's not made for
"Supernatural Jump", that is a different version of the "Athletic Jump" mod.
My mod must be loaded [u]after[/u] Athletic Jump.

[size=3][color=lightblue]Version 1.3:[/color] Important update![/size] Changed completely the way the mod triggers, now it's perfect and compatible with anything, even with other
mods that change jump-related Game Settings (it lets other mods use their values instead of the ones it would use).
Also, now there's nothing to localize so there's only one version for all the languages!
[color=lightblue]Update of the update:[/color] Replaced the scripts with the .bsa file.

[color=lightblue]Version 1.2:[/color] Fixed the jump height and length not resetting to default when you are transformed and
load a save in which you're not. Also fixed other little imperfections.

[color=lightblue]Version 1.1:[/color] Now the jumps will still be higher if you save when transformed, exit and re-enter the game.
Also, now the height at which you begin taking fall damage is higher, while transformed
(the script now modifies also the "fJumpFallHeightMin" Game Setting).


[size=4]-Compatibility-[/size]

With version 1.3, this mod is compatible with anything, even with other mods that change jump-related
Game Settings (it lets other mods use their values instead of the ones it would use).


[size=4]-Installation-[/size]

Simply put the files from the archive into Skyrim's "Data" folder (of course, you can download the mod with Nexus Mod Manager, if you use it).

[size=4]-Uninstallation-[/size]

You better don't uninstall this mod since it uses scripts
(and I don't see why you should, anyway), but if you really want to, then:

- Go to Skyrim's "Data" folder;
- Delete "Werewolves Jump Higher.esp";
- Delete "Werewolves Jump Higher.bsa".[/center]
author: cridus
